self.values._formatting_values() 1992 1993 def concat_same_type(self, to_concat, placement=None): AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute '_formatting_values' ```

It seems like your `ExtensionBlock.values` is an ndarray, while it should be a GeoArray.

I would take a look at `df._data`.

You might also try subclassing the tests in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/tests/extension/base/__init__.py, starting with https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/tests/extension/base/constructors.py, to ensure that the data is being handled correctly, before moving on to other methods.

The original dataframe is correctly constructed (the ExtensionBlock values is still geometry dtype), but not anymore after you subsetted it with `head()`. Which points to a problem in your take or getitem implementation. 
Looking at that, the `__getitem__` returns a plain array, instead of wrapping it again in a GeoArray (take does seem to do it correctly).

Using the tests as @TomAugspurger indicated should indeed normally have catched this (or at least give an indication which parts of the api are still failing)

(sidenote: you are aware of geopandas that (will) implements a GeometryArray?)

Closing since I think fixing `getitem` will solve the problem, but feel free to reopen if that is not yet the case! 
Also welcome to provide feedback on the API and workflow to create an ExtensionArray in general.

@jorisvandenbossche 

I am not aware of GeoPandas efforts, but this isn't for the project, but another GIS venue.
@jorisvandenbossche @TomAugspurger Thank you for the help fixing the `getitem` resolved my issue.

@jorisvandenbossche @TomAugspurger So I fixed the get items as suggested, but now I can't use `iloc` to get single row data.

```
    def __getitem__(self, *args):
        result = operator.getitem(self.data, *args)
        if not isinstance(result, GeoArray):
            return GeoArray(result)
        return result
```

I get the following error:

```

Traceback (most recent call last):
  Debug Probe, prompt 236, line 1
  File "d:\SVN\git_hub\ArcGIS\geo_public\geo\_array.py", line 118, in __repr__
    formatted = self._format_values()
  File "d:\SVN\git_hub\ArcGIS\geo_public\geo\_array.py", line 125, in _format_values
    return [_format(x) for x in self.data]
builtins.TypeError: iteration over a 0-d array

```

I can make it work if I put an `if` statement in the GeoArray, but then all the results return as a GeoArray instead of my `Geometry` object.

Any ideas?

Does your extension array pass the indexing tests in
https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/master/pandas/tests/extension/base/getitem.py
?

I would focus on passing those, before trying the higher-level things like
formatting, since those use getitem internally.
